intro: Yunnanopilia longistaminea, commonly known as the Yunnan bellflower, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue to white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is typically found in moist, rocky habitats at high altitudes. It is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in botanical gardens due to its unique appearance. However, it is also considered endangered due to habitat loss and over-collection.
